Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the uniqueness of the United States inventing the community college, stating that "nobody else had ever done anything like it."
Understate: The claim understates the fact that the idea for community colleges first emerged in 1901, indicating that the concept did exist before the United States.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to substantiate the statement that the United States was the sole inventor of community colleges.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the possibility that other countries may have had similar educational institutions or programs that resemble community colleges.
